stories.title: Create RACING GAME Node
stories.userStory:
As an API contributor
I want to be able to create RACING GAMES
So I can fill gaps in the database
specificationList: A RACING GAME node is successfully created when the request contains valid data. The required data structure is specified in parent (epic) ticket MCA-218. -> Status Code `201`
A successful request returns the created node with all specified properties.
Properties are returned, even when they are empty (optional fields). They are returned with value `null`.
Unknown properties are ignored. They are not processed. They do not produce any info, warning or error messages for the user. -> Status Code `201`
Read-only properties (`id`, `created_at`, `updated_at`) are ignored. They are not processed. They do not produce any info, warning or error messages for the user. -> Status Code `201`
Requests with invalid data are rejected. Cases for invalid data include: missing mandatory fields, syntax errors, wrong data types or wrong data structure. -> Status Code `400`

acceptanceCriteria.title: Requests to create a RACING GAME are accepted when the provided data is valid
acceptanceCriteria.description: Data is valid when its structure is correct, has no syntax errors and contains all mandatory fields.

tests.title: Creating a RACING GAME with valid data
tests.gherkin:
When the user creates a "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" with the following data
  | key | value | datatype |
  | name | Forza Motorsport 7 | string |
  | release_year | 2017 | number |
  | developer | Turn 10 Studios | string |
  | publisher | Microsoft Studios | string |
Then the request should be confirmed with status code 201
And the response should return the "RACING GAME" "F1 2025"

acceptanceCriteria.title: Requests to create a RACING GAME are rejected when the provided data is invalid
acceptanceCriteria.description: Data is invalid when its structure is incorrect, has syntax errors or does not contain all mandatory fields.

tests.title: Trying to create a RACING GAME with missing mandatory information
tests.gherkin:
When the user tries to create a "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" with the following data
  | key | value | datatype |
Then the request should be rejected with status code 400

tests.title: Trying to create a RACING GAME with invalid data types
tests.gherkin:

  | release_year | 2017 | boolean |
  | developer | Turn 10 Studios | boolean |

Then the request should be rejected with status code 400

acceptanceCriteria.title: The response contains all specified properties when creating a RACING GAME
acceptanceCriteria.description: All properties are returned that are specified in the epic MCA-218. When properties are empty they are returned with null values. IDs, timestamp and other meta information might be included too, but is not in the scope of this AC.

acceptanceCriteria.title: Unknown properties are ignored when creating a RACING GAME
acceptanceCriteria.description: The user can provide properties that are not specified in the epic MCA-218, but they will be completely ignored. They will not be processed and there will be no info, warning or error that they were skipped.

tests.title: Expecting unknown properties to be ignored when creating a RACING GAME
tests.gherkin:
When the user creates a "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" with the following data
  | key | value | datatype |
  | name | Forza Motorsport 7 | string |
  | release_year | 2017 | number |
  | developer | Turn 10 Studios | string |
  | publisher | Microsoft Studios | string |
  | thimbleweed | park | string |
Then the response should contain the following properties
  | key | value | datatype |
  | name | Forza Motorsport 7 | string |
  | release_year | 2017 | number |
  | developer | Turn 10 Studios | string |
  | publisher | Microsoft Studios | string |
And the response should NOT contain the following keys
  | key         |
  | thimbleweed |

acceptanceCriteria.title: Read-only properties cannot be overridden by the user when creating a RACING GAME
acceptanceCriteria.description: Read-only properties are for example `ID`, `created_at` and `updated_at`. Analog to unknown properties, those fields will be ignored. They will not be processed and there will be no info, warning or error that they were skipped.

tests.title: Expecting read-only properties to be ignored when creating a RACING GAME
tests.gherkin:
When the user creates a "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" with the following data
  | key | value | datatype |
  | name | Forza Motorsport 7 | string |
  | release_year | 2017 | number |
  | developer | Turn 10 Studios | string |
  | publisher | Microsoft Studios | string |
  | id         | 1234       | number   |
  | created_at | 2025-01-01 | string   |
  | updated_at | 2025-01-01 | string   |
Then the response should contain the following keys
  | key        |
  | id         |
  | created_at |
  | updated_at |
But the response should NOT contain the following properties
  | key        | value      | datatype |
  | id         | 1234       | number   |
  | created_at | 2025-01-01 | string   |
  | updated_at | 2025-01-01 | string   |
